elements.title: a Japanese balloon (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the first intercontinental weapon was not a missile, but a Japanese balloon (example pictured)?

elements.title: Joey Santore (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that YouTuber Joey Santore is known for his "Bill Swerski–esque" Chicago accent and use of profanity on his channel Crime Pays But Botany Doesn't?

elements.title: makwerekwere (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that makwerekwere is the South African equivalent of "barbarians", an offensive and derogatory slur used to refer to foreigners?

elements.title: Marisa Anderson (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Marisa Anderson organized and participated in multiple cross-country walks to raise awareness for various political causes?

elements.title: World-Wide Navigational Warning Service (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the World-Wide Navigational Warning Service divides the entire ocean into just 21 radio areas?

elements.title: 1943 North Texas Aggies (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the 1943 North Texas Aggies went from "kitchen maid" to "queen of the ball" when the Marine Corps sent players from major universities "tumbling onto" the campus?

elements.title: Edgar Nkosi White (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Montserratian playwright Edgar Nkosi White only wrote his first play after he was dared by actor Martin Sheen?

elements.title: Cusrow Baug (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Cusrow Baug in Mumbai had only a few tenants in the 1950s even at a low rent of 40 rupees per month?
